author: sproul
content:
The `store.time` _is_ the wall-clock time. It's just an abstraction to make the spec easier to write. See the first bullet point here: <https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/fork-choice.md#fork-choice>

> - on_tick(store, time) whenever time > store.time where time is the current Unix time

Obviously doing `on_tick` every millisecond as the UNIX time increments is insane, so a sensible way to implement these semantics is by just reading the wall-clock time whenever you read `store.time` in fork choice. That's a valid implementation of the spec, and IMO the intended one.
